member.summary: Constructs a result with the specified collection of result items

The total number of rows based on the input query, but without any paging applied to it.

member.name: P:System.Web.Ria.Data.DataServiceResult.IsDomainServiceException
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the error was a . If the value is true, it indicates that the error should be reconstructed on the client as that exception type.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this result represents an error condition.

member.summary: Gets or sets the custom code for the error.

member.name: P:System.Web.Ria.Data.DataServiceResult.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the message giving details on the error.

member.name: P:System.Web.Ria.Data.DataServiceResult.StackTrace
member.summary: Gets or sets the stack trace for the error.

member.name: P:System.Web.Ria.Data.DataServiceResult.Results
member.summary: Gets or sets the results for the service request

member.name: P:System.Web.Ria.Data.DataServiceResult.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the return value of an service operation

member.name: P:System.Web.Ria.Data.DataServiceResult.TotalCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of rows for the original query without any paging applied to it. If the value is -1, the server did not support total-counts. If it's -2, the total-count is the same as the number of entities in the result-set.

member.name: P:System.Web.Ria.Data.DataServiceResult.ResultCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the total number of rows returned as a result of the query.

member.name: P:System.Web.Ria.Data.DataServiceResult.ValidationErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets the validation errors that occurred during this request.
member.remarks: This is only used when a request invokes a single method, such as a service operation.

member.name: M:System.Windows.Ria.Linq.Utility.IsPredefinedType(System.Type)

member.returns: true if the type is a primitive or standard acceptable types

member.name: M:System.Windows.Ria.Linq.Utility.GetElementType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the underlying element type starting from a given type.
member.remarks: Simple types simply return the input type. If the given type is an array, this method returns the array's element type. If the type is a generic type of , or , this method returns the element type of the generic parameter
member.returns: The underlying element type starting from the given type

member.name: M:System.Windows.Ria.Linq.Utility.ConvertValue(System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Convert the specified value to the desired type.
member.remarks: we need this because json serializer does not specify type information for fields when sending across the wire. When transmitting some types or specific values of some types (e.g. byte), the deserializer thinks the values are Int32 instead of what they should be. So on the server side, we need to try to convert them back to the expected types to see if such conversions are supported.
member.returns: object with specified value and type

member.name: M:System.Windows.Ria.Linq.Utility.ConvertValue(System.Type,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Convert the specified value to the desired type.
member.remarks: we need this because json serializer does not specify type information for fields when sending across the wire. When transmitting some types or specific values of some types (e.g. byte), the deserializer thinks the values are Int32 instead of what they should be. So on the server side, we need to try to convert them back to the expected types to see if such conversions are supported.
member.param: Whether the value is a value coming from a query string.
member.returns: object with specified value and type

member.summary: Checks whether a parameter expects a value to be passed by-value.
member.returns: True if the parameter expects a by-value value.

member.name: T:System.Windows.Ria.Linq.UriEqualityComparer

member.name: T:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1
member.summary: that encapsulates the authentication domain. A domain service extending this one will be used to populate the user on both the client and server.
member.remarks:
System.Windows.Ria.ApplicationServices.DomainAuthentication is designed to interact with a domain service extending this class. To add an authentication service to an application simply extend this or a derived provider.
is designed as an update method, and will be invoked via SubmitChanges on the client. This has a couple implications. First, invoking via AuthenticationService.SetUser will submit all changes that have occurred in the provider and may invoke other update methods. Second, invoking other update methods on the provider from the client will submit all changes and may invoke .
By default, this provider relies on the ASP.NET providers for Membership, Roles, and Profile and will reflect the customizations made in each.
member.typeparam: The type of user data to be provided

member.name: T:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.IAuthentication`1
member.summary: An interface for s that encapsulates the authentication domain. A domain service implementing this interface will be used to populate the user on both the client and server.
member.remarks:
System.Windows.Ria.ApplicationServices.DomainAuthentication is designed to interact with a domain service implementing this interface.
is designed as an update method, and will be invoked via SubmitChanges on the client. This has a couple implications. First, invoking via AuthenticationService.SetUser will submit all changes that have occurred in the provider and may invoke any or all update methods declared on the Domain Service depending on the entities that have been updated. Second, invoking other update methods on the provider from the client will submit all changes and may invoke .
member.typeparam: The type of user data to be provided

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.IAuthentication`1.Login(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Authenticates and returns the identity with the specified name and password.
member.remarks: This method will return a single user if the authentication was successful. If the user could not be authenticated, null will be returned.
member.param: The userName associated with the identity to authenticate
The password associated with the identity to authenticate
Whether the authentication should persist between sessions
member.returns: A single user or null if authentication failed

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.IAuthentication`1.Logout
member.summary: Logs an authenticated identity out.
member.remarks: This method will return a single, anonymous user.
member.returns: A single, default user.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.IAuthentication`1.GetUser
member.summary: Selects the user data for the authenticated identity.
member.remarks: This method will return a single user. If the user is not authenticated, an anonymous user will be returned.
member.returns: An enumerable with a single user.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.IAuthentication`1.UpdateUser(`0)
member.summary: Updates the user data for the authenticated identity.
member.exception: is thrown if the authenticated identity does not have the correct permissions to update the user.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AuthenticationBase class.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.GetProfile(`0)
member.summary: Gets the profile settings for the current user from the and sets them into the specified .
member.remarks:
The is updated from the profile using the following algorithm.
For every property in : if (the property can be set and is in the profile) then set the property value using the value in the profile specified by the alias
member.param: The user to update with the profile settings
member.exception: is thrown if a property in that meets the specified conditions does not have a corresponding profile value.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.UpdateProfile(`0)
member.summary: Writes the profile settings for the current user to the using the specified .
member.remarks:
The profile is updated from the using the following algorithm.
For every property in : if (the property can be read and is in the profile) then use the property value to set the value in the profile specified by the alias
member.param: The user to update the profile settings with
member.exception: is thrown if a property in that meets the specified conditions does not have a corresponding profile value.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.CheckAuthenticationMode
member.summary: Checks that the ASP.NET authentication mode is forms and throws if it is not.
member.exception: is thrown if the ASP.NET authentication mode is not .

member.summary: Gets the for the specified property.
member.param: The property to get the attribute for
member.returns: The attribute or null if one does not exist

member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the specified property has a backing member in the ASP.NET profile.

member.returns: Whether the property is in the profile

This is either:
1) when the property is marked with the attribute. 2) for the specified property.
member.param: The property to get the profile alias for
member.returns: The profile alias for the specified property

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.Login(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Authenticates and returns the identity with the specified name and password.
member.remarks:
This method will return a single user if the authentication was successful. If the user could not be authenticated, null will be returned.
By default, this method can be only used for forms authentication and leverages ASP.NET and .
member.param: The userName associated with the identity to authenticate
The password associated with the identity to authenticate
Whether the authentication should persist between sessions
Optional implementation-specific data. It is unused by this base class.
member.returns: A single user or null if authentication failed
member.exception: is thrown if the ASP.NET authentication mode is not .

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.Logout
member.summary: Logs an authenticated identity out.
member.remarks:
This method will return a single, anonymous user.
By default, this method can only be used for forms authentication and leverages ASP.NET .
member.returns: A single, default user.
member.exception: is thrown if the ASP.NET authentication mode is not .

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.GetUser
member.summary: Selects the user data for the authenticated identity.
member.remarks:
This method will return an enumerable containing a single user. If the user is not authenticated, an anonymous user will be returned.
By default, the user is populated with data from , , and .
In updating the user from the profile, the provider copies the corresponding profile value into each property in . This behavior can be tailored by marking specified properties with the .
member.returns: An enumerable with a single user.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.UpdateUser(`0)
member.summary: Updates the user data for the authenticated identity.
member.remarks:
By default, the user is persisted to the .
In writing the user to the profile, the provider copies each property in into the corresponding value in the profile. This behavior can be tailored by marking specified properties with the .
member.exception: is thrown if the authenticated identity does not have the correct permissions to update the user.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.ValidateUser(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Verifies that the supplied user name and password are valid.
member.remarks: This methods is invoked from . By default, it delegates to . The base implementation does not need to be invoked when this method is overridden.
member.param: The name of the user to be validated
The password for the specified user
member.returns: A value indicating whether the user is valid

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.IssueAuthenticationToken(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Issues a token for the authenticated principal.
member.remarks: This methods is invoked from when the user is authenticated. By default, the method will issue a token by leveraging the cookie support in . The base implementation does not need to be invoked when this method is overridden.
member.param: Whether the token should persist between sessions

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.ClearAuthenticationToken
member.summary: Clears any issued authentication token.
member.remarks: This methods is invoked from . By default, the method will clear tokens by leveraging the cookie support in . The base implementation does not need to be invoked when this method is overridden.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.GetUserCore(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal)
member.summary: Gets the user for the specified principal.
member.remarks: This method will return a single user. If the user is not authenticated, an anonymous user will be returned.
member.param: The principal to get the user for
member.returns: A single user.
member.exception: is thrown if or returns null.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.GetAuthenticatedUser(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal)
member.summary: Gets the user for the authenticated principal.
member.remarks: This method is invoked from and for authenticated users. By default, the user is populated with data from , , and . The base implementation does not need to be invoked when this method is overridden.
member.param: The principal to get the user for
member.returns: The user for the authenticated principal. This should never be null.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.GetAnonymousUser
member.summary: Gets an anonymous user.
member.remarks: This method is invoked from and for anonymous users. By default, the user is populated with data from , and . The base implementation does not need to be invoked when this method is overridden.
member.returns: The anonymous user. This should never be null.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.GetUserImpl(System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal)
member.summary: Gets the user for the specified principal.
member.remarks: The user is populated with data from , , and .
member.param: The principal to get the user for
member.returns: The user for the specified principal

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.CreateUser
member.summary: Creates a new instance of and initializes it with default values.
member.remarks: This method is invoked from and . By default, it returns an instance created with the default constructor. The base implementation does not need to be invoked when this method is overridden.
member.returns: A new instance of

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1.UpdateUserCore(`0)
member.summary: Updates the user data for the authenticated identity.
member.remarks: This method is invoked from after the identity of the current principal has been verified. It is responsible for persisting the updated user data. By default, this method will persist the user using . The base implementation does not need to be invoked when this method is overridden.

member.name: T:System.Web.Ria.ApplicationServices.ProfileUsageAttribute
member.summary: Attribute that describes how a property is backed in an ASP.NET profile. It can be used with custom Entities defined for use with the framework available in .
member.remarks: This attribute is used by the to determine how it should read from or write to the ASP.NET profile that backs the data. If a property is in the profile with the same name, then this attribute does not need to be used. If a property is not in the profile then should be set to true. If a property has been named differently than the profile value that backs it then should be set to the name of the backing value in the profile.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the property is backed by a profile member

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.DataServiceQueryRequest.FlattenGraph(System.Collections.IEnumerable,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.Object},System.Web.DomainServices.DomainServiceDescription)
member.summary: Traverse the result object graph, flattening into a single list. Note that this flattening must maintain relative ordering for the top level elements, since the client might have passed an order expression.
member.param: The list of entities to add to the results.
Map used for the lifetime of the flattening to ensure that each entity is added to the results only once.
member.returns: The length.

member.name: M:System.Web.Ria.DataServiceSubmitRequest.EnsureEntityIdentity(System.Collections.Generic.List{System.Web.DomainServices.EntityOperation})
member.summary: Ensure that all entities in the changeset have their key values set. This is an issue with deleted entities, since foreign key members that are part of the key could have been cleared as a result of entity reference operations on the client

member.returns: The changeset to pass to the service
